conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to force voice reminders even if users do not want them, while User Story B wants ALFRED to activate automatically to support health without the user needing to ask. The conflict is about when and how ALFRED should start voice interactions, with one forcing reminders regardless of user desire and the other expecting automatic activation for support. These are opposing instructions on system behavior for voice activation.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to force smart voice reminders even if users do not want them, so users follow important instructions.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to activate automatically anytime to support my health without me needing to ask.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires all meetings to be held online without exceptions, while User Story B needs online meetings specifically to invite caregivers to exercise sessions. Although both want online meetings, User Story A forbids any other type of meeting, which may conflict with potential offline or hybrid meetings desired for other purposes.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to hold all meetings online without exceptions, so I can explain updates and keep control.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to invite my caregiver to virtual exercise sessions so we can share challenges and keep me motivated.
